history.1.0.0: Initial release containing exactly the content of the Four Souls Requiem Ultimate Collector's Box.

about: JSON doesn't support comments. This notes object will give details about this data in a semi-structured way.
This data contains all cards included in the Four Souls Requiem Ultimate Collector's Box.
Documentation for the root object x can be found in 'notes.x'
If a reference is made to an object x, it is documented in 'notes.x'
I have house ruled a few cards. Those have been given the 'modified' tag.

deck_ratios.treasure: List of 'deck_ratio' objects to create a custom treasure deck. Objects are given in order of precedence.
deck_ratios.loot: List of 'deck_ratio' objects to create a custom loot deck. Objects are given in order of precedence.
deck_ratios.monster: List of 'deck_ratio' objects to create a custom monster deck. Objects are given in order of precedence.

notes.character: List of 'card' objects for character cards.
notes.starting_item: List of 'card' objects for starting item cards.
notes.treasure: List of 'card' objects for treasure cards.
notes.loot: List of 'card' objects for loot cards.
notes.monster: List of 'card' objects for monster cards.
notes.soul: List of 'card' objects for soul cards.
notes.room: List of 'card' objects for room cards.
notes.other: List of 'card' objects for other cards.

deck_ratio.count: Amount of slots on the deck for that tag.

card.id: A 9 character unique ID for a given card. The first character signifies the type of card: c, t, l, m, s, r, and o for the card types that start with the same letter, and i for starting items. The last character is a dash for the 'base' card, and another letter for cards that are some how not the 'base' version of a card, such as t for tained.
card.name: The name printed on the card, or an assumed name if there is none printed on the card. Names need not be unique. A card with the same name only has the same id if it is functionally the same card in a gameplay sense. So no distinction would be made for alt art cards with the same text, but a distinction would be made for cards with the same name but different rule text.
card.count: Amount of this specific card in the box.
card.threeplus: Whether or not the card is meant for 3+ players.
card.tags: List of tags in order of preference.
card.link: List of card ids this card is somehow linked to. Generally used to link characters with their starting item. Some monsters also require other monsters in the deck. Some monsters are linked to cards that start outside the game.

monster.name: Dogma
link: Requires the "Harbingers" card to be set aside
